}}In [[Middle-earth Role Playing]], '''Tulwang''' was a land on a peninsula west of [[Ciryatanor]], north of [[Hyarn]], and southeast of [[Far Harad]].<ref>{{EndorMap|Tulwang}}</ref>

==History==
As the Chaialla [[Drúedain|woses]] were pushed away from their homeland in Chy by the migrations of Men, they dwelled in Tulwang during the first two decades of the [[Second Age]]. When Men later settled in [[Far Harad]], the woses moved to what later became Hyarn by {{SA|20}}.<ref name="timelinesouth">{{ICE|3900}}, pp. 6-10</ref>

Around {{SA|700}}, [[Númenor]] established embassies in Tulwang. It is in Tulwang that its fleet landed in {{TA|2280}}, when [[Tar-Ancalimon]] moved against the rebellious [[Fifth of the Nazgûl|Akhôrahil]] of [[Ciryatanor]].<ref name="timelinesouth"/>

In {{TA|1399}}, the [[Army of the Southern Dragon]] attacked Tulwang in its first known campaign.<ref name="timelinesouth"/> After centuries, the Army finally conquered the land in {{TA|1657}}. Tulwang later split apart in various petty kingdoms during the civil war of {{TA|2013}}.<ref name="timelinecitadel">{{ICE|8205}}, pp. 5-6</ref>

The [[Far Harad#Portrayal_in_adaptations|Sun Lord]] Pon Ifta attacked Tulwang in {{TA|2224}} and swiftly conquered it in {{TA|2229}}.<ref name="timelinecitadel"/>
{{references}}
